verbose_text: A study by Wang et al revealed that transfection of miR-200b in Rink-1 cells (pancreatic cell line) inactivated the Notch signaling pathway directly by decreasing the levels of Jagged-1/2 and those of their target genes Hes-1, Hey-2 and Bcl-2, which led to the inhibition of cell growth.
evidence: miR-200b in Rink-1 cells (pancreatic cell line) inactivated the Notch signaling pathway directly by decreasing the levels of Jagged-1/2 and those of their target genes Hes-1, Hey-2 and Bcl-2
